dynamic_methods.source_code:
def classImplements(class_, *interfaces):
        """
        Declare additional interfaces implemented for instances of a class.

        The arguments after the class are one or more interfaces or
        interface specifications (`IDeclaration` objects).

        The interfaces given (including the interfaces in the
        specifications) are added to any interfaces previously
        declared.

        Consider the following example::

          class C(A, B):
             ...

          classImplements(C, I1, I2)


        Instances of ``C`` provide ``I1``, ``I2``, and whatever interfaces
        instances of ``A`` and ``B`` provide. This is equivalent to::

            @implementer(I1, I2)
            class C(A, B):
                pass

        .. seealso:: `zope.interface.classImplements`
        .. seealso:: `zope.interface.implementer`
        """

def classImplements(class_, *interfaces):
        """
        Declare additional interfaces implemented for instances of a class.

        The arguments after the class are one or more interfaces or
        interface specifications (`IDeclaration` objects).

        The interfaces given (including the interfaces in the
        specifications) are added to any interfaces previously
        declared.

        Consider the following example::

          class C(A, B):
             ...

          classImplements(C, I1, I2)


        Instances of ``C`` provide ``I1``, ``I2``, and whatever interfaces
        instances of ``A`` and ``B`` provide. This is equivalent to::

            @implementer(I1, I2)
            class C(A, B):
                pass

        .. seealso:: `zope.interface.classImplements`
        .. seealso:: `zope.interface.implementer`
        """

def classImplements(class_, *interfaces):
        """
        Declare additional interfaces implemented for instances of a class.

        The arguments after the class are one or more interfaces or
        interface specifications (`IDeclaration` objects).

        The interfaces given (including the interfaces in the
        specifications) are added to any interfaces previously
        declared.

        Consider the following example::

          class C(A, B):
             ...

          classImplements(C, I1, I2)


        Instances of ``C`` provide ``I1``, ``I2``, and whatever interfaces
        instances of ``A`` and ``B`` provide. This is equivalent to::

            @implementer(I1, I2)
            class C(A, B):
                pass

        .. seealso:: `zope.interface.classImplements`
        .. seealso:: `zope.interface.implementer`
        """

def providedBy(self, ob):
        """Is the interface implemented by an object
        """
        spec = providedBy(ob)
        return self in spec._implied

def directlyProvidedBy(object):  # pylint:disable=redefined-builtin
        """
        Return the interfaces directly provided by the given object.

        The value returned is an `IDeclaration`.

        .. seealso:: `zope.interface.directlyProvidedBy`
        """

def providedBy(self, ob):
        """Is the interface implemented by an object
        """
        spec = providedBy(ob)
        return self in spec._implied

def directlyProvidedBy(object):  # pylint:disable=redefined-builtin
        """
        Return the interfaces directly provided by the given object.

        The value returned is an `IDeclaration`.

        .. seealso:: `zope.interface.directlyProvidedBy`
        """

test_source_code:
def test_directlyProvides(self):

        class IA1(Interface):
            pass

        class IA2(Interface):
            pass

        class IB(Interface):
            pass

        class IC(Interface):
            pass

        class A(Odd):
            pass
        classImplements(A, IA1, IA2)

        class B(Odd):
            pass
        classImplements(B, IB)

        class C(A, B):
            pass
        classImplements(C, IC)

        ob = C()
        directlyProvides(ob, I1, I2)
        self.assertIn(I1, providedBy(ob))
        self.assertIn(I2, providedBy(ob))
        self.assertIn(IA1, providedBy(ob))
        self.assertIn(IA2, providedBy(ob))
        self.assertIn(IB, providedBy(ob))
        self.assertIn(IC, providedBy(ob))

        directlyProvides(ob, directlyProvidedBy(ob) - I2)
        self.assertIn(I1, providedBy(ob))
        self.assertNotIn(I2, providedBy(ob))
        self.assertNotIn(I2, providedBy(ob))
        directlyProvides(ob, directlyProvidedBy(ob), I2)
        self.assertIn(I2, providedBy(ob))
